pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [4863fe3391](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18113/commits/4863fe33912c7e99934636bfee6e11dc164b3cb0)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.TwoSidedIdeal.Operations | 626 | 617 | -9 (-1.44%) |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.SimpleRing.Basic | 642 | 651 | +9 (+1.40%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.TwoSidedIdeal.Operations`|-9|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.SimpleRing.Basic`|9|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ iff_injective_ringHom`
`+ iff_injective_ringHom_or_subsingleton_codomain`
`+ injective_ringHom`
`+ injective_ringHom_or_subsingleton_codomain`
`+ ker_eq_bot`
`+ ker_ringCon_mk'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Import change seems fine for a leaf file

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11747989809/job/32731113363)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11747989809/job/32731113051)
bors merge
bors merge
You can probably golf slightly with `Or.imp` instead of `Or.recOn`
indeed!
What's the `⟨⟩` for? Should it say `mem_top` instead?
yes, probably. thanks

I suggest
```suggestion
    ∀ {S : Type u} [NonAssocRing S] (f : R →+* S), Function.Injective f ∨ Subsingleton S where
  mp h _ _ := injective_ringHom_or_subsingleton_codomain
  mpr H := of_eq_bot_or_eq_top fun I => by
```
Since you have written out the terms in each branch explicitly, you could avoid tactic mode using `Or.imp`.

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma ker_ringCon_mk' (I : TwoSidedIdeal R) : ker I.ringCon.mk' = I :=
```

This could even replace the existing `RingHom.injective`, right?
See https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Field/Basic.html#RingHom.injective

If we put this in a file with minimal imports, I think that would be a good refactor.
Indeed, let me try

Wait, maybe no. Two-sided-ideal does not work on semiring, we really do need subtraction. So `TwoSidedIdeal.ker f` only makes sense for `f : R -> S` between `NonAssocRing`s. Therefore, `SimpleRing.injective_ringHom` need the target to have subtraction at all. `RingHom.injective` however works on target that is only a `Semiring`. So neither version is a generalisation to the other one: one works for nonassoc ring; one works for semirings
I will write an implementation note to note this

Ok, let's merge this as is now.
But I think we could generalize `TwoSidedIdeal` and `IsSimpleRing` so that they make sense in the context of non-assoc semirings.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/SimpleRing/Basic): characterise simple ring in terms of injectiveness
